channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: S&P 500 Futures Fall; Dollar Strengthens
item.description: Oil prices rose and stock futures faltered as investors weighed the risk of escalating conflict in the Middle East against signs that the U.S. economy...

item.title: ‘Their house was purchased with my family money’: My late father left a life estate to his second wife. She’s only 10 years older than me. How can I undo this?
item.description: “Apparently the probate laws in Florida are different, perhaps superseding the will.”

item.title: Eurozone Government Bond Yields Edge Higher on Supply But Could Soon Fall Back
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields edged higher, pressured by incoming supply and higher oil prices, but Commerzbank said bond prices could soon recover,...

item.title: Can Rockefeller Center Rise From the Ashes of New York's Office Market?
item.description: The owner of the famous skyscraper is looking for more than $3 billion to refinance its maturing loans.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s bond sales signal he’s preparing to pick up Japanese stocks
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway has previously used yen-denominated bond sales to fund investments in the Japanese stock market

item.title: Wall Street Races to Bring Private Credit to the Masses
item.description: Investing titans are jostling to launch funds made up of hard-to-trade private loans.

item.title: If stocks struggle in early 2025, you can blame the new U.S. president
item.description: Stocks often struggle in the three months after Inauguration Day.

item.title: Estate planning has become more urgent for rich people as the election nears. That’s why tax laws need fixing, critics say.
item.description: Wealthy families’ focus on the estate tax is fodder for critics of the U.S. tax system and a preview of the fierce debate coming when the Trump tax cu...

item.title: This group is the worst at talking about money with their families, and here’s what they should do.
item.description: Get started talking about taboo money topics with your family — even if you’re ashamed or worried about getting ripped off

item.title: Sterling Falls After BOE's Bailey Hints at More Aggressive Rate Cuts
